definitions.title: vb.
definitions.body: impel, thrust, banish (esp. Dt. Je. and later) (NH id., beguile, Hiph, Niph.; Aram. [[נְדַח]] (rare) = BH; Eth. nadh.a:; thrust; Ar. nadaxa is drive a ship to shore);—
impel (i.e. wield) an axe, sq. [[עַל־]] De 20:19;
be impelled: [[וְנִדְּחָה יׇרוֹ בַּגַּרְוֶן]] be impelled with the axe De 19:5.

be thrust out, banished: of dispersion in exile, sq. [[שָׁם]] Je 40:12, Je 43:5 (‖[[שׁוּב]]); sq. [[לִפְנֵי]] Je 49:5 (‖[[קִבֵּץ]]); cf. also fig. [[תֻּשִׁיׇּה נִדְּחָה מִמֶּנִּי]] Job 6:13 is banished from me, i.e. is non-existent; esp. Pt. banished one(s), outcast(s), as acc. cogn. c. [[נׇדַח]]2Sa 14:14; c. [[קִבֵּץ]]Mic 4:6, De 30:4, Zep 3:19, Ne 1:9; [[יִשִׂרָאֵל]] ´[[נ]], c. [[אָסַף]] Is 11:12 (‖[[נְפֻחוֹת יְקַבֵּץ]]); c. [[קִבֵּץ]] Is 56:8; c. [[כִּנֵּס]] Ps 147:2; c. [[הֵשִׁיב]] 2Sa 14:13, Ez Eze 34:4, Eze 34:16 (both ‖[[אׂבֵד]]); c. [[בּוֹא]] Is 27:13 (‖ id.); v. also Is 16:3, Is 16:4, Je 49:36; outcast = neglected one, fig. of Zion Je 30:17 (‖[[דּׂרֵשׁ אֵין לָהּ]]).
driven away (from herd, i.e.) straying De 22:1.
thrust away, aside from ´[[י]] to idiolatry De 4:19, De 30:17 (sq. [[וְהִשְׁתַּחֲוׇה]]).

definitions.title: Pu.
definitions.body: Pt. [[אֲקֵלָה מְנֻדָּח]] Is 8:22 thrust into darkness.

thrust out, banish, esp. of exile, subj. ´[[י]], c. acc. sq. [[שָׁ֫מָּה]] De 30:1, Je 46:28; Je 16:15 (‖[[הֶעֱלָה]]); sq. [[שָׁם]] Je 8:3, Je 24:9, Je 29:18, Da 9:7 + Ez Eze 4:13 (om. LXX Co); Je 23:3 (‖[[קִבֵּץ]]), v:Je 23:8 (‖[[הֶעֱלָה]], [[הֵבִיא]]) Je 29:14 (‖[[קִבֵּץ]], [[הֵשׁׂיב]]), so Je 32:37; also Je 27:10 (‖[[הַרְחִיק]]), v:Je 27:15 (‖[[אָבַד]]), cf. Je 23:2 (Judah under fig. of flock, subj. evil shepherd, ‖[[הֵפִיץ]]), Je 50:17 (Isr. as sheep, subj. enemies as lions); of driving out priests 2Ch 13:9; invader Joe 2:20 (sq. [[אֶל־]]); wicked Ps 5:11 (‖[[הַאֲשִׁימֵם]]); good man from his eminence Ps 62:5 (sq. [[מִן]]).
thrust away, aside, from ´[[י]] to idolatry, c. acc., De 13:14; sq. [[מִן־הַדֶּרֶח]] v:De 13:6; ´[[מֵעַל י]] v:De 13:11; ´[[מֵאַחֲרֵי י]] 2Ki 17:21 Qr (Kt v. [[נדא]]); cf. 2Ch 21:11 (‖[[הִזְנׇה]]).
compel, force, subj. adulteress (by flattery), sq. acc. Pr 7:21 (‖[[הִטָּה]]).

definitions.title: Hoph.
definitions.body: Pt. [[מֻדָּח]] chased, hunted, ´[[חְבִי מ]] Is 13:14, sim. of fugitive Babylonians.
